Rotation Utilities¶

Methods

RotationUtils.BuildRotationMatrix(omega, phi, kappa, dtype='degrees')[source]¶

Builds rotation matrix from image to world, according to a z-y’-x” rotation:

\[\begin{split}{\bf R}_{\omega, \phi, \kappa} = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & \cos(\omega) & -\sin(\omega) \\ 0 & \sin(\omega) & \cos(\omega) \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} \cos(\phi) & 0 & \sin(\phi) \\ 0 & 1 & 0\\ \sin(\phi) & 0 & \cos(\phi) \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} \cos(\kappa) & -\sin(\kappa) & 0\\ -\sin(\kappa) & \cos(\kappa) & 0\\ 0 & 0 & 1 \end{bmatrix}\end{split}\]
Parameters:
  • omega (float) – rotation about x-axis
  • phi (float) – rotation about y-axis
  • kappa (float) – rotation about z-axis
  • dtype (str) – angles units (‘radians’ / ‘degrees’ / ‘symbolic’). Default: ‘degrees’
Returns:

rotation matrix 3x3 nd-array
RotationUtils.ExtractRotationAngles(R, dtype='degrees')[source]¶

Extracts rotation angles from the rotation matrix

Note

The angles returned are subjected to ambiguity

Parameters:
  • R (nd-array 3x3) – rotation matrix
  • dtype (str) – should the output be in ‘degrees’ or ‘radians’ (default ‘degrees’)
Returns:

(omega, phi, kappa) according to the dtype
RotationUtils.RotationByKappa(kappa, dtype='degrees')[source]¶

Builds a rotation matrix about the z-axis

Parameters:
  • kappa (float) – angle
  • dtype (str) – angles units (‘radians’ / ‘degrees’ / ‘symbolic’). Default: ‘degrees’
Returns:

a 3x3 rotation matrix, around the z-axis

Builds a rotation matrix about the y-axis

Parameters:

  • dtype (str) – angles units (‘radians’ / ‘degrees’ / ‘symbolic’). Default: ‘degrees’
Returns:

a 3x3 rotation matrix, around the y-axis
RotationUtils.Rotation_2Vectors(from_vector, to_vector)[source]¶

Computes rotation matrix from ‘fromVector’ to ‘toVector’

Rotation by angle between ‘fromVector’ and ‘toVector’ around the unit vector - Link to information <https://math.stackexchange.com/questions/180418/calculate-rotation-matrix-to-align-vector-a-to-vector-b-in-3d>_

\[\bf{R} = \bf{I} + \sin(\alpha) \cdot [v]_\times + (1-\cos(\alpha))\cdot[v]_\times^2\]

with \([v]_\times\) skewsymmetric inner product matrix (i.e., \(v=a_\text{from vector}\cdot b_\text{to vector}\); and \(\alpha\) the angle between from and to vectors

Parameters:
  • from_vector (np.ndarray) – the vector from which the rotation matrix should be computed
  • to_vector (np.ndarray) – the vector to which the matrix should rotate to
Returns:

rotation matrix
Return type:

np.ndarray
RotationUtils.Skew(v)[source]¶

Builds a skew symmetric matrix from an array

Parameters: v (nd-array) – 3x1 array

:return skew symmetric matrix

RotationUtils.decdeg2dms(dd)[source]¶

Convert from decimal degrees to degree-minute-second :param dd: degree in decimal degrees :type dd: float

Returns: degree in dms
Return type: tuple (degree, minutes, seconds)
